Article Title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella announces data center and AI partnership with Indian companies
Article Text: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella announced strategic partnerships with leading organizations across key sectors of the Indian economy at the Delhi leg of Microsoft’s AI Tour in India, in addition to a $3 billion investment in cloud and AI infrastructure.Microsoft chairman and CEO Satya Nadella announced partnerships with RailTel, Apollo Hospitals, Bajaj Finserv, Mahindra Group, and upGrad, alongside a collaboration with India AI, a division of Digital India Corporation, to advance AI adoption nationwide.The company will establish new data centers in India over the next two years as part of its investment strategy. This expansion comes as AI usage in India has increased from 63% in 2023 to 72% in 2024, according to a recent IDC study commissioned by Microsoft.The partnership with RailTel includes a five-year agreement to transform the Indian railways and public sector through AI implementation. Apollo Hospitals will collaborate with Microsoft on healthcare solutions, including the development of four specialized healthcare copilots for clinicians, patients, nurses, and hospital operations.Bajaj Finance Limited aims to transform into a "FinAI company" targeting 200 million customers, with expected annual cost savings of INR150 crore in FY26. The Mahindra Group will establish a dedicated AI Division to develop solutions across its automotive, farm, and financial services businesses.In the education sector, upGrad's partnership with Microsoft aims to train 1 million Indian STEM learners in AI skills by 2025, utilizing tools like Microsoft 365 Copilot and GitHub Copilot.The collaboration with India AI includes ambitious goals to skill 500,000 individuals by 2026 and establish AI Productivity Labs in 20 National Skill Training Institutes across 10 states. The initiative will train 20,000 educators and support 100,000 AI innovators and developers."The world is looking to India's leadership in AI," said Puneet Chandok, president of Microsoft India and South Asia. He emphasized that Microsoft's partners are helping advance the country's AI capabilities while democratizing access to technology and resources.
Article Summary: Microsoft announced partnerships with RailTel, Apollo Hospitals, Bajaj Finserv, Mahindra Group, and upGrad. The company will establish new data centers in India over the next two years. This expansion comes as AI usage in India has increased from 63% in 2023 to 72% in 2024.

Article Title: Davos dhamaka: Telangana strikes it rich with Rs 1.8L crore investments
Article Text: HYDERABAD: Telangana has secured a staggering Rs 1.78 lakh crore in investments at the 2025 World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos-a four-fold increase in investments compared to the previous year.This has the potential to create more than 49,500 jobs and underscores the state's growing prominence as a global investment hub, senior officials stated.With chief minister A Revanth Reddy leading Telangana's delegation, the state struck major deals with 16 top companies in sectors such as technology, green energy, defence, and data infrastructure. "The record-breaking Rs 1.78 lakh crore investment secured at Davos is a game changer for Telangana, with major global players like Amazon (AWS), Sun Petrochemicals, and Megha Engineering leading the pack," an official said. The Telangana govt had secured Rs 41,000 crore in investments at the 2024 WEF.The deal with Amazon, valued at Rs 60,000 crore, stands as the single largest investment, while Sun Petrochemicals follows closely with Rs 45,500 crore.These investments are expected to generate 49,500 new jobs, with software giants HCL, Infosys, and Wipro committing to hire thousands of skilled workers. Besides the chief minister, the team at Davos included IT and industries minister D Sridhar Babu, special chief secretary Jayesh Ranjan and others.
Article Summary: Telangana has secured a staggering Rs 1.78 lakh crore in investments at the 2025 World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos. This has the potential to create more than 49,500 jobs and underscores the state's growing prominence as a global investment hub.

Article Title: Delhi weather: City's temperature drops to 11 degrees; trains and flights delayed
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Several flights and trains were delayed at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi on Friday due to persistent foggy weather. The minimum temperature recorded in the city was 11 degrees Celsius, according to the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD).Visuals from various parts of the city, including ITO, India Gate, Dhaula Kuan, and Kartavya Path, showed poor visibility due to the fog. People were seen taking shelter in camps set up by the Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board (DUSIB) around the city."All facilities have been provided to people coming here to take shelter. If anyone from outside also comes, we welcome them to seek shelter whole heartedly." said a manager of one of the shelter camps.The Air Quality Index (AQI) in the city was recorded at 207 at 7 am this morning, as per the Central Pollution Control Board.'Under the impact of a fresh western disturbance , there was fresh snowfall on the mountains. The winds have turned north-westerly, so the temperature will begin to fall. The minimum and maximum may both fall by 3 to 4 degrees Celsius by the weekend,' said IMD.On Thursday, Delhi’s maximum temperature was 24.8°C at Safdarjung, five degrees above normal. Pitampura was the warmest spot in the city at 25.7°C. The minimum temperature rose slightly to 11°C on Thursday, compared to 9.3°C on Wednesday, due to cloudy skies trapping heat.Delhi’s air quality also saw slight improvement but remained in the ‘poor’ category, with an average Air Quality Index (AQI) of 257 on Thursday. The AQI is expected to stay poor for the next few days, according to forecasts.
Article Summary: Several flights and trains were delayed at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi on Friday due to persistent foggy weather. The minimum temperature recorded in the city was 11 degrees Celsius, according to the Indian Meteorological Department. People were seen taking shelter in camps set up by the Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board around the city.

KOLKATA: The father of Shariful Fakir, the illegal Bangladeshi immigrant arrested by Mumbai police for allegedly stabbing actor Saif Ali Khan during a burglary attempt at his Bandra home, has claimed that the police have framed his son."They have arrested my son as a suspect, but he is not the one whose photograph the police had released after the incident... They have picked him up as he has some similarities. He is also an easy target just because he had entered India illegally," Md Rohul Amin, 55, also a village level BNP functionary, told TOI over a WhatsApp call from Bangladesh.The man in the photograph had long hair that touched his eyes. But my son has always had shorter hair raised upwards. Amin, who is also a village level Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) functionary, said he is already speaking to senior leaders in his country to raise the "false arrest" of his son as a diplomatic issue.Shariful is the second among Rohul's three sons. While his elder son works at a private firm in Dhaka, the younger son still studies in school. Shariful had dropped out from school after Class 10 and started doing odd jobs after Rohul lost his job at Khulna jute mill."We may be poor, but we are not criminals. In Bangladesh, he used to ride a bike taxi for a living. But during the era of Awami League, there was a lot of political turmoil in our village and after Sheikh Hasina's government came back to power early last year. Since my son was an active supporter of Khaleda Zia, he faced immense backlash and so he decided he had to leave Bangladesh for better earning and living prospects," said Rohul.He said Shariful got in touch with an agent who helped him illegally cross the border and enter India in April last year. While police in Mumbai said he crossed Dawki river to reach Meghalaya and then reach West Bengal via Assam, his father couldn't specify the details."He hadn't shared with us about how he had exactly entered India but there are multiple persons like him who leave Bangladesh and head for India illegally for work. Once he reached India, he went to West Bengal and worked at a restaurant for a few days, before he went to Mumbai and started working at a bar. He had also met a relative of ours in Bengal but he refused him accommodation," said Rohul, who now works as a farmer at Rajabaria village in Jhalokhathi district of Bangladesh.Rohul said that on Friday evening, more than 38 hours since the stabbing incident at Saif Ali Khan's Bandra residence, Shariful called home and told his father that he had transferred 10,000 Bangladeshi taka via a hawala agent leaving only 3,000 taka for himself."He can never loot or attack someone. Police have framed him just because he is an easy suspect. We demand justice," he said, breaking down into tears.
Article Summary: Shariful Fakir, an illegal Bangladeshi immigrant, was arrested by Mumbai police for allegedly stabbing actor Saif Ali Khan during a burglary attempt at his Bandra home. His father Md Rohul Amin, 55, has claimed that the police have framed his son. He is already speaking to senior leaders in his country to raise the "false arrest" of his son as a diplomatic issue.
